intro: Ruschia elineata, commonly known as the silver leaf Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery coating. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the spring and summer months. Ruschia elineata is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
